body_html:
@iganichev That’s great news!

When I pass tf.contrib.gan.losses.minimax_loss_discriminator to implicit_value_and_gradients and then call it with discriminator output on real and generated samples, I get an error that there are no variables to compute the gradients on.
body_text:
@iganichev That’s great news!
When I pass tf.contrib.gan.losses.minimax_loss_discriminator to implicit_value_and_gradients and then call it with discriminator output on real and generated samples, I get an error that there are no variables to compute the gradients on.
body:
@iganichev That’s great news! 

When I pass `tf.contrib.gan.losses.minimax_loss_discriminator` to `implicit_value_and_gradients` and then call it with discriminator output on real and generated samples, I get an error that there are no variables to compute the gradients on.
